connector.description: The Splunk HEC sink allows to send data to Splunk using the https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Data/UsetheHTTPEventCollector[HTTP Event Collector].

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.splunkUrl.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.splunkUrl
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.splunkUrl.description: The URL of your Splunk server. No need to set the protocol prefix. Example: my_server.splunkcloud.com:8088

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.token.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.token
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.token.description: The Token of the HEC. Note it is not the user's authentication token.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.hostPayloa.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.hostPayload
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.hostPayloa.description: The host field set in the data sent to Splunk, it is not related to the Splunk URL or the connection to Splunk server.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.bodyOnly.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.bodyOnly
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.bodyOnly.description: Send to Splunk only data contained in the body.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.headersOnl.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.headersOnly
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.headersOnl.description: Send to Splunk only data contained in the headers.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.source.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.source
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.source.description: The source named field of the data.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.sourceType.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.sourceType
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.sourceType.description: The source named field of the data.

camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.time.name: camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.time
camel.kamelet.splunk-hec-sink.time.description: Time this even occurred. By default, the time will be when this event hits the splunk server.
